newsitem.title: USA: Nine West comfortable with Q1 estimates.
newsitem.headline: Nine West comfortable with Q1 estimates.

text.p: Nine West Group said Wednesday it is comfortable with Wall Street estimates for its first-quarter earnings.
"At this point, we believe we are in line with Street expectations," said Robert Galvin, Nine West's chief financial officer, during a conference call.
Nine West expects to release results on May 29.
According to First Call, the consensus first quarter earnings estimate is $0.47 a share and the range is $0.46 to $0.48.

Earlier today, Hambrecht & Quist cut its rating on Nine West to a hold from a buy due to uncertainty about a Securities and Exchange Commission investigation into the company's revenue recognition policies.

However, Hambrecht & Quist analyst Hank Wilson, in a report, maintained his 1997 earnings estimate of $3.00 a share on revenues of $1.86 billion as well as his 1998 estimate of $3.55 on revenues of $2.13 billion.
Trading in shares of Nine West was halted pending an announcement. The company's shares closed at 32-1/2.
